image.altText: A young girl with pigtails plays on the sand at the beach.

props.synopsis: The ACT Coroner is handing down his findings following an inquest into the 2022 death of five-year-old Rozalia Spadafora, who suffered cardiac arrest at the Canberra Hospital.

title.children: Delay in treating five-year-old Canberra girl left her with no opportunity for survival, coroner finds

image.altText: A public bus with a wrap on the back that reads "MyWay+".

props.synopsis: Speaking to Stateline, ACT Chief Minister Andrew Barr concedes the government should have waited several more days before rolling out a new public transport ticketing system that was plagued with problems as it went live.Â

title.children: ACT government concedes it should have postponed MyWay+ rollout by at least a week

image.altText: Canberra Hospital taxi near emergency department

props.synopsis: New data shows the average time patients spent being treated in ACT emergency departments has improved in the past financial year, but Canberra Health Services still failed to meet all but one of its emergency wait-time targets.

title.children: Canberra has shortest emergency department stay in the country, but fails on other fronts

image.altText: A post-impressionist painting of a crowded Australian beach.

props.synopsis: At first glance artists Ethel Carrick and Anne Dangar seem to have little in common besides gender and career choice, but a new exhibition at the National Gallery of Australia is inviting visitors to take a closer look.

title.children: Two 'important yet under-acknowledged' women artists celebrated in National Gallery of Australia exhibition

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: The Canberra woman, who cannot be named for legal reasons, was prepared to pay $20,000 for her parents to be killed and had paid $7,500 towards that goal.

title.children: Woman spared further jail time after hiring hit man to kill parents on dark web

image.altText: A building sign that reads 'ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal'.

props.synopsis: The ACT Civil and Administrative Tribunal found the ACT government discriminated against the public servant over her criminal history.

title.children: ACT government ordered to pay former employee $265k after finding she was discriminated against

image.altText: Georgie sits on a rowing machine, rowing in her workout gear.

props.synopsis: This year's Paris Games was the worst performance from the Australian rowing team at the Olympics in decades, highlighting gaps in the sport's accessibility â but a new initiative set up in Canberra is hoping to change that.

title.children: Some sports aren't accessible to public school students. This program is trying to change that

image.altText: Students in a classroom with male teacher in background.

props.synopsis: Four Canberra schools have recorded above average results in this year's NAPLAN tests of literacy and numeracy skills.

title.children: Four ACT schools perform above average in 2024 NAPLAN tests

image.altText: A childcare centre playground with a slide and a sandpit visible.

props.synopsis: The ACT Legislative Assembly acknowledges widespread problems happening at Genius Education, which claims to run more than 30 centres across the country, including five in the ACT.

title.children: ACT government demands answers after Genius childcare staff walk off the job citing delayed wages

image.altText: Maggie Tabberer smiles at a red carpet event.

props.synopsis: She started her career as a model and later became a household name through her work in publishing and television and was a two-time Gold Logie winner.

title.children: TV and fashion personality Maggie Tabberer dies aged 87

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Jeremiah Manele shake hands in front of a row of Australian and Solomon Islands flags.

props.synopsis: The federal government is preparing to unveil a slew of Pacific initiatives designed to bolster its strategic position in the region. Â

title.children: Australia ramps up policing and security assistance to Solomon Islands

image.altText: Father of Bianca Mark Jones is among the pallbearers carrying her casket out of her funeral

props.synopsis: Melbourne teen Bianca Jones has been farewelled by family and friends at a funeral at her old school, after her death from methanol poisoning during a holiday in Asia.

title.children: Teen's 'profound impact' remembered at funeral service after methanol poisoning death

image.altText: A man walking down a street wearing a black t shirt

props.synopsis: The 53-year-old and his four co-offenders faced a marathon six-month trial in the NSW Supreme Court over the scheme.

title.children: Construction boss George Alex jailed for conspiring to defraud ATO of more than $10 million

image.altText: A view from under a thermometer looking up towards the sun in a blue cloudy sky

props.synopsis: Last year eclipsed predicted temperatures. Now a new study suggests the extra warming occurred when the Earth became less reflective due to a drop in low cloud cover.

title.children: Disappearing clouds could have contributed to hottest year on record

image.altText: A young woman holding a large stuffed toy looks at the camera with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Vika Zadnipryana and Nastia Shadura became amputees when Putin's Russian military hit their homes with missiles. They struck up a friendship while recovering in hospital.

title.children: Teens who met in Ukrainian hospital after Putin bombed their homes have a message for the world

image.altText: A close up shot of the French President Emmanuel Macron delivering a speech.

props.synopsis: Emmanuel Macron used a televised address to accuse the far right and hard left of sowing chaos, after a no-confidence vote brought down the French prime minister and government.

title.children: Macron defiant after no-confidence vote topples French government

image.altText: CCTV vision of an old man wearing a face mask and wearing a hat and casual attire.

props.synopsis: Police are appealing for community assistance to identify a man who ignited gas cylinders and caused fires in two legal practices, including a Legal Aid NSW office in Gosford CBD.

title.children: Police appeal for help to find man who ignited gas cylinders in Gosford legal offices

image.altText: Storm clouds over Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Thunderstorms are likely to hit Australia's south-east over the weekend as "very humid" weather normally felt in the Far North takes hold, the Bureau of Meteorology warns.

title.children: Severe thunderstorms forecast for parts of south-eastern Australia amid 'very humid' weather

image.altText: A man wearing a hoodie on CCTV, smiling as he leans against a counter.

props.synopsis:
Multiple US media organisations, citing unnamed investigators, say the ammunition used to shoot the UnitedHealth chief executive had the words "deny," "defend" and "depose" written on them.

Â

title.children: Words reportedly written onto ammunition found at scene of health insurance CEO's killing

image.altText: An image of the Big Four Australian banks ATMs side by side

props.synopsis: The federal government is in secret talks with the banking sector, which could see a levy imposed on banks with little or no regional presence.

title.children: Regional town banks have been closing their doors in droves â one solution could see customers paying more

image.altText: An aerial view of Syrian rebels on motorcycles riding around two destroyed tanks on a dusty road.

props.synopsis: Rebels entered the city of Hama, a key strategic city, dealing a new blow to Syrian President Bassar al-Assad and allies Iran and Russia.

title.children: 'The beginning of the regime's fall': Syrian rebels claim second major city in lightning advance

image.altText: Jasprit Bumrah celebrates the wicket of Steve Smith

props.synopsis: If it seems like your favourite Test side is getting rolled for next to nothing more often than usual, it is because they are. A look at the numbers behind the resurgence of the red ball over the last decade shows bowlers are making a serious comeback in the longer form of the game.

title.children: Amid the crash and bash of T20 cricket, bowlers have slowly reclaimed control in Tests and the game is better for it

image.altText: The colour shade demonstrated in a piece of leather

props.synopsis: A team of "global colour experts" have unveiled the colour of the year and no, it's not brat green. Â

title.children: A 'comforting and warm' brown has been named colour of the year

image.altText: A composite image of a man in a suit and a woman wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: It's no secret the government is impatient for a rate cut, and frustrated we're not seeing one. But it can't say so, because that would invite attacks it was pressuring the independent bank.

title.children: Frustrated government can only bite its tongue as it waits on Michele Bullock

image.altText: A man in a business shirt and suit jacket sits in a chair in an office, looking serious as he's interviewed for television.

props.synopsis: Following a three-month external review, the NSW government found there was no basis to proceed with misconduct proceedings against John Minns.

title.children: NSW Strata Commissioner John Minns cleared of misconduct following Four Corners investigation

image.altText: Two large gold coins bearing engraved "b"s lie on top of a complex financial line-and-bar graph

props.synopsis: It's a wild ride for crypto prices, with volatility for Bitcoin after it surpassed $US100,000. The local share market has fallen, while Woolworths is attempting to end strike action affecting its supply chain. Follow the day's events and insights on our live markets blog.Â

title.children: Bitcoin price volatile after hitting record, ASX in the red

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Former RBA chief economist questions the bank's current economic understanding
ASX extends losses on widespread falls
Number of multiple job holders hits record-high

image.altText: A shot of a blue and white plane in the air taken  from below

props.synopsis: Boeing's guilty plea is blocked under a deferred prosecution agreement in the case which dates back to two fatal crashes in 2018 and 2019 that killed 346 people.

title.children: US judge rejects Boeing's guilty plea deal over fatal 737 Max crashes citing diversity policies

image.altText: Man in dark suit standing talking.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton said the quiet part out loud this week when asked why he was taking so long to release his nuclear costings.

title.children: When Dutton was asked about his nuclear drip-feed, he said the quiet part out loud

image.altText: A macaque monkey sits on a wooden bridge in an enclosure.

props.synopsis: Launceston's popular City Park macaque monkeys could be gone in 20 years, as a motion to restrict their breeding goes before the council.

title.children: Launceston's popular CBD monkeys to come to an end if council sterilisation push passes

image.altText: a young man and young woman hype up the crowd on the stage of a Christian youth camp

props.synopsis: New Australian research has found that young men are identifying as Christian and seeing the benefits of organised religion at much higher rates than women of the same generation.

title.children: More Australian Gen Z men are turning to God, while Gen Z women leave the church in large numbers

image.altText: A man sits on a bench outside his house on the phone

props.synopsis: Greg Ross is familiar with the view from outside his Queensland home because it is the only place he can receive a call.Â

title.children: Business owners struggle for signal after Telstra shuts off 3G network

image.altText: A woman with teal and black hair, wearing red lipstick and blue graphic eyeliner looks into a small makeup mirror, smiling.

props.synopsis: Organisers of two LGBTQIA+ festival events in regional Australia say they were targeted online with abusive comments, forcing them to hire security and replace performers. Feast Festival's CEO has called on the state government to offer better legal protection for the community. SA's Attorney-General says the government is open to looking at the matter.Â

title.children: Online abuse prompts performers to drop out of regional burlesque and drag show

image.altText: An Indian batter walks from the field after being dismissed by Australia in the first women's ODI in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Australia expects India's top order to offer more resistance when the two teams return to Brisbane's Allan Border Field for the second match of their ODI series.

title.children: Aussies prepared for 'more grit' from India after claiming ODI series lead

image.altText: A satellite image of a large body of ice.

props.synopsis: Australian and international scientists have used satellite imagery to chronicle the collapse of a New York City-sized ice shelf in Antarctica, shedding light on key processes linked to future sea level rise.

title.children: Two years ago, an Antarctic ice shelf 'suddenly disappeared'. Scientists now know how it happened

image.altText: A chef in a white jacket sits next to an elderly woman in a blue vest. He is writing on paper, and she has food in front of her

props.synopsis: Aged care kitchens are improving the nutrition, variety and taste of their meals to bring flow-on benefits to residents.

title.children: Inspired by Maggie Beer's mission, aged care homes embrace better meals
